headline: Tariffs Spark Steep Declines in Stock Futures; Oil and Dollar Climb
summary: Stock futures fell and oil prices rose Sunday after the U.S. imposed sweeping tariffs on imports from major trading partners, jolting Wall Street’s outlook for the American economy.  Futures linked to the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite led the declines, falling by more than 2%, while the S&P 500 slipped by 1.6%.  Changes in futures prices don’t always reflect market moves after the opening bell.
